data.title: Nice Folk & Good Pizza close to French Quarter
data.text:
This place is off the beaten path, but it is a great bar & Grill
Love the Pizza, so good thin crust Pizza, and plenty of other food options.  Servers are nice and attentive

user_location.name: Port Saint Lucie, Florida, United States

data.title: Good pizza
data.text: I got super lucky and walked in to order a take out pizza, and I was the only person there. While waiting for my order, another person came in, and we got our orders at the same time. It seemed to take a while, but the food was good, and my waitress was friendly.

data.title: Cool little pizza spot
data.text: This is a cool little local spot downtown, walking distance from our hotel. They also have a nice selection of sandwiches.  Quaint and yummy!

data.title: Good pizza
data.text: We were staying not far away and wanted a pizza from a local place. The hotel clerk recommended this place and he didn't disappoint. The pizza was excellent and took advantage of the happy hour of $2 draft beers. Would go back again.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: Was able to enjoy a meal from Big Pie Pizza & Bar. Our family got take out one night while on our trip. The sandwiches were huge, well worth the money. The pasta was great, and appetizers also.

data.title: Okay
data.text:
Our hotel concierge recommended that we eat here for good pizza at a good price. We ordered an extra large which looked more like a medium size. We're a family of four and each of us had two very small slices. No joke. The pizza was decent but nothing to special. We also ordered a large green salad which was good because we ate all the salad because the pizza was so small. 

I remember reading reviews on BPPB and many reviews complained about the service, but our waitress was great.

data.title: Sooo slow
data.text: Do not come here expecting speed.  Ridiculous!! The bartender was nice but it took her 4 minutes just to say hi to us.  Probably not coming back.

data.title: Terrible service
data.text: Reheated microwaveable pizza. Cassey the "bartender" was terrible and rude. She was even on the phone telling customers calling to order to-go pizza that she was "not just someone answering the phone, but a bartender", and had "other more important customers waiting"... Even though I was the only person there... We have tried to visit this place on both a Friday and Saturday  night and were treated terribly both nights. It's a shame with the location being so close to major hotel chains that we were not treated as legitimate customers. Big fail on customer service. We will never return and will certainly not recommend to others.

data.title: Tasted ok but made us ill
data.text: My first impression of this place was that it seemed a little dirty (not clean). However after reading previous reviews we decided to give it a go. Bad decision. Four of us ate there today, four different pizzas and all of us ended up being ill. I'm guessing food poisoning as the symptoms are sickness, diarrhea, stomach cramps and shivering. Avoid this dirty unclean establishment.

data.title: Yummy for the Tummy
data.text: Since the hotel we were staying at was having their restaurant under renovation, we order delivery to our room. The food was absolutely wonderful and in fact we order 3 of our 5 night time meals from them instead of going out.

data.title: Great Lunch Spot
data.text: Went in for a quick lunch. We split the large meat lovers pizza and had plenty. Good service, good price. Looks like it would be a great local bar in the evenings as well.

data.title: Over rated
data.text:
Stopped by for a few beers and a pizza. Host/ bartender spent most of her time sitting with friends and not to attentive. Had a few drinks. The place started to get busy so I ordered food. 

I wanted to order on type of pizza with just a change of the protein. The have a no change policy. Would have been cheaper for me and them. 

Continued with my order. The bartender did come to life and put my order in. 

Pizza had not much flavor and the one extra ingredient I had ordered was non existent. 

On my way out I stoped by the bathroom and looked in the kitchen. 

NO PIZZA oven!!! 

Just a reheating oven!

Explains all...

data.title: Good pizza reasonable price.
data.text: Waiting for our room at la pavillon we went across the street and tried the pizza.  It was far better than I expected and at only 25 bucks including the pizza,  a Corona,  and the tip I felt it was a great value.  Plus,  the employees were also very friendly and helpful.

data.title: Just okay
data.text: My family and I stopped in here because it was close to our hotel and the kids were hungry.  The service was friendly but slow and the food was just okay.  Don't think I would go back.

data.title: Great for delivery
data.text: Didn't want to go out one night, but this place delivered some of the best sandwiches I have eaten, all with a little New Orleans style.. and great fries as well.  I had an Eggplant Wrap that was out of this world.

data.title: Our "go to" local to wind down after big days.
data.text:
We were staying at the Homewood Suites on the corner so convenience rated highly. BPPB always seemed to be open when we wanted a late snack and/or a "cleansing ale". We ate and drank there on at least three occasions during the week we were in NOLA. Probably the closest thing to a local pub you'd compare to in Oz (in terms of atmosphere). On each night the crowd was a little different: from highly entertaining to mildly annoying. But isn't this what your local is all about? The bar staff were always friendly and attentive. The menu was good and strightforward with lots of choices and there was never any problems in straying from the norm to get the sandwiches or pizzas customised. We always left there feeling happy, relaxed and extemely well-fed and served.
Cheers

data.title: Amazing clean pizza!!!
data.text:
Wow wow this place this place is great!!! 
I will definitely come back here in the future. 
Great drinks and amazing pizza!!!!!

data.title: Good pizza
data.text: Stopped here for dinner our first night in NOLA, it was a Sunday evening and only 2 girls were working. They felt stressed and we only 2 of 4 people in the place. They had take out orders too. Salads were really good, super fresh veggies and lettuce but didn't get what we ordered. It was okay though because they were really good. Ordered the big pie pizza, nice thin crust, yummy pizza but NO toppings hardly and this was supposed to be like the most toppings of all their pizza. And it was missing 2 of toppings the menu said it should have. Hubby got 2 beers, had to get 2nd himself. Not very attentive but good for cheap pizza.

data.title: Just what we needed!
data.text: My husband and I got into town late and needed food.  Our late night go-to is pizza.  Our hotel recommend this place.  It was very good and made with fresh ingredients. I would definitely recommend out yup friends.

data.title: Good choice on Mardi Gras day
data.text: My wife and I tried this place for lunch on Mardi Gras day when several other places we tried were closed. Doesn't look like much from the street. Only a few tables and a bar. Spinach feta cheese appetizer was very good. Got the veggie pizza which had a crispy crust. Was pretty good pizza. Service was ok but the waitress was by herself and it got pretty busy so had to ask for drunk refills, etc.  overall was a pleasant place for lunch.
